data.title: NewsMuseum
data.meta_description: O NewsMuseum é um espaço experiencial dedicado às notícias, aos media e à comunicação, que irá ocupar o antigo Museu do Brinquedo em Sintra. Este projeto irá proporcionar aos seus visitantes a maior experiência de media e comunicação da Europa.
data.text:
The jewel of our technological crown presents content in a giant touch screen with a 360º projection of the major episodes of the last 100 years narrated by Media

Considered the greatest discipline of Journalism, the media coverage of war conflicts has a prominent place at the NewsMuseum, in a room that has José Rodrigues dos Santos as the curator

We witness the passion of the Communication world for the sports show and we compare the media performances of two world number 1s - Eusébio and Cristiano Ronaldo. We honor Cândido de Oliveira and we remember "Ripa-na-rapaqueca" of the transistor age

How a past episode almost hidden in a small community in the countryside of Portugal becomes a global media phenomenon and makes Fátima a top brand of catholicism. Content in development

"Here command post of Movimento das Forças Armadas [Armed Forces Movement]." Joaquim Furado, on the microphones of RCP in a booth we replicate at the NewsMuseum, where the visitor is invited to record a message. The night of Radio in Portugal and other audible moments of our life

The weapons, the swords and slpas have been replaced by words. The great duels of our time are healthily in the Media. Soares vs Cunhal. Saramago vs Lobo Antunes. Reactionary forces vs Revolutionary forces...

How will our relation with Media be in 2046, four hundred years after the birth of Gazeta, the first Portuguese newspaper? It is a journey in Virtual Reality (VR). Can cause nausea

Choose the situation and record a "live" report as if you were present at the time, with the support of professional teleprompter. And show the fans your reporter skills after you publish on NewsMuseum's YouTube channel

The episodes no one wants to happen and that journalists love to cover. Titanic, Chiado, JF Kennedy, Alcafache, 9/11, Camarate. The details of the media coverage of the "Bad News"

The world of narrative, reputation, personal and institutional marketing. It's the "dark side" rarely referred to by the Media - and, almost always, to the negative side. Source of power and influence

We go to Bairro Alto, the "village" of Lisbon where historical newsrooms, the printers of big editions, the popular selling point coexisted. And the restaurants and bars that journalists of the 20th century went to

Portugal is one of the countries with the highest quality in terms of Freedom of the Press. Because we live in this environment, we are led to believe that Freedom of the press is more universal than it actually is. Only 1 in 7 citizens in the world live in systems in harmony with this fundamental right. Our luminous globe updates Reporters Without Borders reports and allows you to consult the "ranking" of nations.

An entertained challenge we pose to our visitors. Those who never published a news story, but are known all over the planet. It’s a colourful entertainment
